segments.text: I see the woman standing there, focused on drying a plate, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascades over the sink and onto the floor, forming a puddle that grows larger by the second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost comical how absorbed she is in her task, oblivious to the potential disaster at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a bit anxious about the children, especially the boy on that rickety stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He stretches toward the cookie jar, balancing precariously as if he’s about to tip over at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is eagerly watching, her hand raised like she’s making an offering to the cookie gods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a contrast—the calm outside the window and the brewing storm inside this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think if the woman looks up now, she might just see the chaos unraveling right in front of her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But she seems lost in her own little world, a world where everything is just fine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The tension in the air thickens, and I can’t shake off this feeling of impending doom for those kids.
segments.speaker: PAR
